page.title: 10QUEEN'S VISIT TO HIGHTOWN
page.content: A couple of weeks before the visit, some{Irish}people were asking, in the course of conversation with some local residents, about where the{ammunition was stored on the{Rifle Range.}This incident was reported to the{Police who immediately started visiting Hightown's houses, asking if anybody unusual had been seen e.g. if any strangers had been seen or if anyone was trying to{rent}houses in Hightown. The day before the visit, banners and flags were put up around the route the Queen was to take. The odd{Lynx {helicopter}patrolled the area. On the day itself, many Police and {Military Policemen}patrolled from early morning onwards. Crowds began to line the streets from about 9.45a.m. Orange tape barriers were put up along the Royal route.
